Don Vicente solicita un crédito para compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas y herramientas que necesita  para sus cultivos y de esta manera aumentar sus cosechas y abastecer la gran demanda que posee, además mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Don Vicente is 60 years old and lives alone in his own home. He grows corn, beans, and sorghum. Vicente is a responsible and honest person who is friendly with his customers. Thanks to the work he does, he is able to pay for some of his expenses.

Don Vicente is requesting a loan in order to buy farming supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, and tools that he needs for his crops. This will enable him to increase his harvest and meet the large existing demand. As a result, he will be able to improve his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, herbicides, and tools.

loans.name: Gonzalo Alexander

texts.es:
Gonzalo es un joven de 19 años,  con educación media culminada, está acompañado, tiene un hijastro de 6 años que estudia en el kínder, están viviendo en una casa alquilada donde solo la habitan ellos 3.

2 años de experiencia laboral, limpiando pescado en una empresa, que junto con su compañera de vida viajan todos los días, para obtener el sustento diario.

Él se vio obligado a obtener un crédito con fines de cubrir los gastos que su compañera de vida ha tenido ya que ella padece de una enfermedad en el corazón. Y nunca se había podido tratar dicha enfermedad hasta hoy en día que se ha vuelto un tanto delicada y peligrosa. Con esto ellos estarían un poco más tranquilos y trabajar para mantener a su pequeño hijastro.


Ellos en un futuro han planeado poseer un excelente record crediticio y así se les pueda  otorgar un crédito para construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is a 19 year old young man with a high school education. He has a partner and a 6 year old stepson who is in kindergarten, and the three of them live together in a rented home. He has two years of work experience cleaning fish for a company where both he and his partner work everyday in order to earn their daily sustenance. 

He now finds himself in need of obtaining a loan in order to cover expenses for his partner, as she suffers from a heart condition. She has never been able to treat this condition until now because the situation was very delicate and dangerous. With this, the couple will be a bit more stable and able to work to provide for his young stepson. 

In the future the couple plans to establish an excellent credit history and thereby be able to obtain a loan to be used for building their own home.

loans.use: cover expenses that his life partner has incurred as she suffers from a heart condition.

loans.name: Domingo Miguel

texts.es:
Domingo es un hombre de 63 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Domingo no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil.
Por iniciativa propia, Domingo trabaja como albañil, el realiza construcciones de diversas obras, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Domingo se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprará herramientas como cubos, lampas, madera y otros, así pues Domingo seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su propio carro donde pueda transportar sus materiales de trabajo.
texts.en:
Domingo is 63 years old and lives in the city of Pisco with his wife and two children.  He is very friendly, hard-working, and enthusiastic.  Like his wife, Domingo puts all his efforts into helping the family get ahead.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of money and because he needed to work, Domingo was not able to study to become a civil engineer.

Through his own initiative, Domingo works as a builder, constructing various things.  He works every day for around ten hours and he thinks it is going well because of his dedication and effort. 

Domingo is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to the help provided, he will be able to buy tools, such as buckets, pickaxes, wood, and more.  With this Domingo will continue working and putting in the effort so that he can achieve his big dream of having his vehicle. in which to transport his work materials.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Eva

texts.es:
Eva, le surge la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo por la facilidad de pago que la Institución le brinda y asimismo porque requiere de capital de trabajo, ya que hoy lo invertira en mariscos; esta adquisición le ayudara a comprar mariscos, tales como: pescado, chacalín, camarones, entre otros.
Con el crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar las ventas, posee mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Las condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en: Eva wishes to apply for new loan through her institution because it provides her an easy method of payment and because she requires working capital, which she will use to purchase seafood. This acquisition will help her to purchase seafood such as fish, shrimp, prawns, and other items. Eva's previous loan helped her to increase her sales, and she now has greater income and a better quality of life for her family. Her economic conditions have improved.

loans.use: purchase fish, prawns, shrimp, and other items.

loans.name: Ladis Del Carmen

texts.es: Ladis es madre de un hijo de 4 años de edad y vive en unión libre con su pareja. Por falta de oportunidades laborales y debido a la difícil situación económica por la que atravesaba, decidió buscar la opción de generar ingresos por cuenta propia, por lo que montó un puesto de venta de comida, allí ofrece arepas con carne desmechada, con pollo y gaseosas; de esta manera ha logrado obtener los ingresos necesarios para llevar el sustento a su hogar, durante un año y medio que lleva en funcionamiento. Ladis es una mujer emprendedora, juiciosa, pujante y dedicada a su familia y a su labor. Ha sobrepasado muchos obstáculos, pues está expuesta a muchos riesgos por el hecho de encontrarse ubicada en la calle. Sin embargo, esto no ha sido motivo para desistir, por el contrario, cada día se esfuerza más para sostener su negocio, pues se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos. Esto la motiva para solicitar su primer ciclo de crédito, que será invertido en la compra de activos fijos (carrito de perros) e insumos al por mayor (arepas, pollo, carnes frías, panes, salsas, gaseosas, productos desechables), con el fin de fortalecer su negocio, incluyendo nuevos productos como perros calientes y hamburguesas, con lo que le podrá ofrecer más variedad de productos a los clientes que la visitan, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas y por ende, sus ingresos. De esta manera podrá impulsarse para alcanzar el sueño de tener su negocio ubicado en un local propio, donde pueda mejorar las condiciones de trabajo e incrementar su clientela, ofreciendo comodidad y un excelente servicio a sus comensales; con lo cual podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida y disfrutar de un mejor bienestar al lado de su familia.
texts.en:
Ladis is the mother of a four-year-old son and lives with her partner. She had few job opportunities and found herself in a difficult financial situation, so Ladis decided to try and earn a living on her own. She opened a food stall 18 months ago and offers arepas [a stuffed corn meal dish] with pulled meat, chicken, and sodas. The income from her business has allowed Ladis to meet her household expenses. 

Ladis is a very hard-working, sensible, energetic woman who is devoted to her family and to her work. She has overcome many obstacles and faces many risks by working in the street. However, Ladis doesn't see this as a reason to give up, but rather strives each day to sustain the business that has become her main source of income. 

Having met so many challenges and established her business, Ladis has decided to apply for her first loan, which she will use to purchase fixed assets (a food cart) and wholesale supplies (arepas, chicken, cold cuts, breads, salsa, sodas, and disposable goods). These items and new products such as hamburgers and hot dogs will strengthen Ladis's business by allowing her to offer a greater variety of items to her customers. A broader menu will boost sales and income and allow Ladis to pursue her ambition of opening a restaurant. A fixed location would mean better working conditions and more customers. Ladis could also offer comfort and high-quality service to her customers. Realizing this dream will allow Ladis and her family to enjoy better living conditions and a happier life.

loans.use: to purchase fixed assets (a food car) and wholesale inventory (breads, salsas, cold cuts, sodas, disposable products)

loans.name: Bibiana María

texts.es: Bibiana, con 29 años de edad,  es casada y no tiene hijos. Durante 12 años se ha dedicado a la actividad comercial, trabajando como empleada en diferentes almacenes de ropa y accesorios. Hace aproximadamente 2 años, decidió independizarse y montar su propio almacén en un local comercial, aprovechando la experiencia y el conocimiento adquirido durante el tiempo que laboró; de esta forma ha logrado obtener los recursos necesarios para aportar a la economía de su hogar, apoyando a su esposo con la carga económica. Bibiana es una mujer pujante, emprendedora, arriesgada y activa, siempre va en busca de oportunidades que le permitan crecer y vio en el crédito, un apoyo para lograrlo. Este préstamo será invertido en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, correas, camisetas, gorras, accesorios, entre otros), de esta manera podrá ofrecer más variedad de artículos para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, aumentando sus ventas y sus ingresos. Bibiana sueña con fortalecer su negocio, acreditarlo y prestar un mejor servicio, para que sea reconocido, con lo cual podrá ofrecer oportunidades de empleo y además mejorará significativamente las condiciones de vida, para disfrutar  un futuro más próspero al lado de su esposo.
texts.en: Bibiana is 29 years old, married, and doesn’t have any children.  For twelve years, she has been engaged in business, working as an employee at various clothing and accessory stores.  About two years ago, she decided to become independent and to open her own store in a commercial location, taking advantage of the experience and knowledge she acquired during the time she was working.  In this way, she has earned the income she needs to support the household, and help her husband with the financial burden.  Bibliana is a strong, enterprising, daring, active woman who is always looking for opportunities that allow her to grow and she saw the loan as a way to help her achieve this goal.  She will invest this loan in the purchase of wholesale merchandise (blouses, jeans, belts, T-shirts, hats, accessories, and other items). In this way, she will be able to offer a wider variety of articles to satisfy her customers’ tastes and needs, and increase her sales and income.  Bibliana dreams of strengthening her business, building a good reputation, and providing better service so that she will become well-known and be able to offer employment opportunities.  In addition, she will significantly improve her living conditions to enjoy a more prosperous future alongside her husband.

loans.use: to purchase (blouses, jeans, belts, T-shirts, hats, accessories, and other items).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Progreso - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PROGRESO - 26,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete  mujeres y un varon,   la presidenta  del banco es la Sra. Alejandra  tiene 27 años tiene 2 hijos que son de las edades de 3 y 9 años, ella se dedica al comercio minorista, ofreciendo variedad de productos desde cosas de cocina como electrodomésticos y variedad de productos según la temporada, visitando y entregando a su mercadería a puestos de venta y domicilios, ya que entrega sus productos a crédito, la Sra. Alejandra  vive en su domicilio que  se encuentra en la zona de Tembladerani ,  este préstamo es el  primero que ha tomado con la institución, la Sra. Alejandra  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de mercadería,  ya que tiene muchos pedidos y así de esta  manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de mercadería, la Sra. Alejandra  enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos productos y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención con la compra de variedad de producto,  la Sra. Alejandra  se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: The “Progreso-26” communal bank is comprised of eight members, seven ladies and one gentleman.  The president of the bank is Alejandra.  She is 27 years old and has two children, ages 3 and 9.  She is engaged in a retail business, offering a variety of products such as kitchen appliances and a variety of seasonal products. She visits points of sale and homes and delivers her merchandise on credit.  Alejandra lives in the Tembladerani area.  This loan is the first that she has taken with the institution.  She is going to use this loan to purchase merchandise because she has many requests and in this way, she will increase her working capital.  The purpose of her loan request is to purchase merchandise.  One of the challenges Alejandra faces in her business is that there is demand for new products.  When she uses the benefits, she is going to take better care to purchase a variety of products.  Alejandra feels happy and grateful to the institution for their support in granting the loan.

loans.use: to purchase appliances and household goods.

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Эльмире 28 лет, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. Супруг активно помогает по хозяйству. В поисках основного источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2008 году Эльмира начала заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Стартовав с 10,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день ее хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве содержит: 1 дойную корову с приплодом. Также имеет земельный надел размером 0,60 ГА, где в основном выращивает -перец, капусту, фасоль и клевер. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эльмира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 20,000 сом (KGS) на закупку селитры. Доходы от кредита Эльмира планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота, а также намерена сделать ремонт дома.
texts.en: Elmira is 28 years old, married, and has three children. Her husband actively helps with the household. In search of a source of income for her family, Elmira started farming and raising animals in 2008. Having started with 10,000 som (KGS), today she earns a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS). She owns 1 milk cow and it's calf, and a 0.60 hectare parcel of land where she mostly grows peppers, cabbage, beans, and clover. In order to further develop her business, Elmira is asking the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a 20,000 som (KGS) loan to buy fertilizer. Elmira plans to use the income from the loan to obtain more livestock, and she also intends to make repairs to her house.

loans.use: to buy nitrate

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.ru: Элеоноре 39 лет, вместе с супругом воспитывает  3 детей, из которых старший сын является студентом, остальные школьники. Cупруг помогает по хозяйству. Элеонора в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается откормом скота и реализации, стартовав 20 лет назад с покупки скота на 2 000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Элеоноры в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеетс: 7 лошадей, 4 коровы, 1 нетель, 1 бычок, 5 овец, а также имеется земельная доля, размером 0,89 ГА на которой она ежегодно сажает пшеницу. Ежемесячный доход составляет 9,500 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Элеонора обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота с дальнейшим откормом скота и реализации. Доходы от кредита Элеонора планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на обучение младших детей.
texts.en: Eleonora is 39 years old, and along with her husband is raising three children, the oldest of which is a college student, and the rest of whom are in grade school. Her husband helps her with the business. Eleonora provides the sole source on income for her family by fattening and selling livestock. She began doing this 20 years ago by spending 2,000 som (KGS) to buy animals. Thanks to her tireless work, Eleonora today owns seven horses, four cows, one heifer, one bull calf, and five sheep, and also has a 0.89 hectare land plot where she plants wheat each year. Her monthly income is 9,500 som (KGS). With the goal of further developing her business Eleonora is asking  the micro finance bank Bai Tushum and Partners for a 70,000 som (KGS) loan to buy livestock for fattening and sale. She plants to invest the profit earned into further expanding her herd of livestock, and plans to save for the education of her younger children.

loans.use: to buy calves for further fattening and resale

loans.name: Gulsoro

texts.ru:
Гулсоро 41 год. Она более 15 лет занимается растениеводством. У нее есть муж и двое сыновей. Муж помогает ей в обработке, посеве и сборе урожая. Гулсоро на небольшом участке земли выращивает сельскохозяйственные культуры по сезону. Летом она в основном выращивает арбуз, а к концу лета лук, пшеницу и чеснок. Гулсоро имеет большой опыт в земледелии. Она продолжает ремесло своего прадедушки, именно у него она научилась как обращаться с землей. 
Сейчас Гулсоро просит кредит для повторного сезонного посева. Она хочет приобрести семена лука, пшеницы, чеснока, а также минеральные удобрения и топливо. Гулсоро в будущем хочет увеличить посев сельскохозяйственных культур.
texts.en: Gulsoro is 41 years old. She has been farming for over 15 years. She has a husband and two sons. Her husband helps her with soil preparation, planting, and harvest. Gulsoro grows seasonal crops on her small plot of land. In the summer she mostly grows watermelon, and at the end of summer, onions, wheat, and garlic. Gulsoro has a lot of experience in farming. She is continuing in the footsteps of her great-grandfather, from whom she learned how to relate to the land. Now Gulsoro is asking for a loan for her second planting. She wants to buy onion, wheat, and garlic seed, as well as fertilizer and fuel. In the future she would like to expand her plantings.

loans.use: To buy onion, wheat, and garlic seed, as well as fertilizer and fuel.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She has been engaged in crab fishing, together with her husband, for more than 10 years. This is the source of her income.

Jocelyn is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and lead weights. With these items, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish and other sea products to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Belinda works hard to support her family. She has a general store in the Philippines, and she earns additional income by farming sugarcane. 

Belinda is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy items to sell at her store, like shampoo, milk, sugar, and coffee. Belinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream:  to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell at her store, like shampoo, milk, sugar, and coffee

loans.name: Eutiquo

texts.en:
Eutiquo is a farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol. He is a married man, and he has been in the farming business for more than 30 years. This is the source of his income. 

Eutiquo is asking for a loan, which he will use to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay for farm labor to help with the farm. With this use of the loan, he will be able to improve the productivity of his farm, increasing his crop yield and profit. Eutiquo hopes to expand his business and make it a success.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide, and to pay for farm labor to help with the farm

loans.name: Kaiyrkul

texts.ru: Кайыркул 46 лет, вдова, одна воспитывает четверых детей. Кайыркул пришлось нелегко, после смерти мужа, но она собрала силу в кулак и решила жить дальше ради своих детей. Из детей: старшая дочь помогает материально матери, дочь торгует продуктами питания на рынке. Остальные дети помогают по хозяйству. Кайыркул в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается откормом скота и реализации, стартовав в 2008 году с покупки скота на 25,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Кайыркул и активной помощи со стороны детей, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 бычка и 4 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кайыркул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков с дальнейшим откормом и реализацией. Доходы от кредита Кайыркул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует купить швейную машинку для старшей дочери, которая любит заниматься шитьем.
texts.en: Kaiyrkul is 46 years old, widowed, and has four children. She had a hard time after the death of her husband, but she gathered her strength and decided to keep going for her children. Of her children, her oldest daughter provides material help, since she sells groceries at the market. The rest of the children help around the property. Kaiyrkul provides the primary source of income for her family by raising and selling livestock. She started the business in 2008 by spending 25,000 som (KGS) on buying animals. Thanks to her tireless work and the active participation of her children, she now owns 2 bull calves and four sheep. Her monthly income is 15,000 som (KGS). With the goal of further developing her business, Kaiyrkul is asking the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a 70,000 som (KGS) loan for the purchase of calves for fattening and sale. She plans to invest income from the loan into further expanding her number of livestock, and she also plans to buy a sewing machine for the oldest daughter, who loves to sew.

loans.use: to buy calves for fattening and sale

loans.name: Finauvale

texts.en:
Finauvale is 42 years old and married. She has six children. She runs a small business, selling coconut biscuits (cookies) in her community. She has been doing this for two years.

Finauvale has requested a loan. She will use the funds to buy flour, oil, sugar, big basins, spoons and plastic bags. She joined SPBD in 2011, to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Finauvale will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and utensils for making and selling coconut cookies, including flour, oil, sugar, big basins, spoons and plastic bags

loans.name: Jonicel

texts.en:
Jonicel earns a living by managing her sari-sari (variety store), selling various goods to the people in her area. Jonicel lives with her family in the town of Carlos P. Garcia, Bohol. She has been in business for more than 10 years.

Jonicel is asking for a loan to buy more goods to sell at her store, like canned goods, candies, soda and other beverages. With these goods, she will be able to improve the diversity of her stock and attracting more buyers into her store.

In the future, Jonicel hopes to make her business a success and sustainable. Furthermore, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and for reinvestment into that same business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell at her store, like canned goods, candies, soda and other beverages

loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru: Сайёра замужняя женщина в возрасте 49 лет. Она проживает в районе Шахритус. У Сайёры двое сыновей, которые помогают ей в деятельности. Сайёра занимается растениеводством, а муж работает мигрантом в России. Сайёра имеет участок орошаемой земли, на которой занимается посевом бахчевой культуры, пшеницы и овощей. Она занимается земледельческой деятельностью вот уже 5 лет и получает хорошую прибыль с продажи урожая. Сайёра в данный момент просит кредит для повторного посева. На сумму кредита она хочет приобрести минеральные удобрения, топливо, семена пшеницы, лука и чеснока. Ее планы на будущее - увеличить посевы.
texts.en: Sayora is a 49 year old married woman. She lives in the Shahrituz region. Sayora has two sons who help with her work. She farms, and her husband is a migrant worker in Russia. Sayora has a plot of land where she plants rotations of wheat and vegetables. She has been farming for five years already, and receives a good income from selling the harvest. Sayora is now asking for a loan for her second planting. She wants to use the loan to buy fertilizer, fuel, and wheat, onion, and garlic seed. Her plans for the future are to increase plantings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, fuel, and wheat, onion, and garlic seed.

loans.name: Cerila

texts.en:
Cerila, 55, is married and has five children. She lives in Patawag, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. Cerila operates her own 'sari-sari' (variety store) to earn a living. She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns 3,000 doing this type of work.

She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000. She will use it for additional capital to buy things to sell at her store, including soft drinks, canned goods and other inventory. Cerila is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell at her store, including soft drinks, canned goods and other inventory

loans.name: Fern

texts.en:
Fern is 20 years old and single, and she has two children. She runs a small business, selling fast foods in her community. She has been doing this work for one year, now.

Fern has requested a loan. She will use it to buy raw bananas, foam plates, sugar, chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, cordials and onions. She joined SPBD in 2011, to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Fern will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy raw bananas, foam plates, sugar, chicken, sausages, mutton flaps, cordials and onions

loans.name: Geogracias

texts.en:
Geogracias is married and has three children. She is 38 years old, and she lives in Patawag, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She operates her own 'sari-sari' (variety store) to earn a living. She has had this business for four years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this work.

She has requested a loan for PHP 15,000. She will use the additional capital to buy more goods to stock her store. Geogracias is a new member of PMPC. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to stock her sari-sari store

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 48 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con su esposa y sus 5 hijos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Juan no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Juan trabaja como obrero de campo y construcción, adicionalmente con apoyo de su esposa tiene una pequeña carreta de venta de golosinas, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y esfuerzo.
Juan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara mayor cantidad y variedad de golosinas para surtir su carreta, así pues Juan seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan is a 48 year old man who lives in the city of Pisco with his wife and their 5 children. He is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic. He and his wife dedicate all their efforts to raising their family, but unfortunately due to a of lack of financial resources, Juan could not study the agronomy career he wanted.

Juan works as a field laborer and in construction and with the help of his wife has also has a small cart selling snacks. 
Juan is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because with their help he will be able to buy a greater quantity and variety of sweets to supply his wagon so John can continue to work to better his family.

loans.use: to buy treats

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es: Haydee es una mujer de 35 años que vive junto a su esposo Eduardo y sus 3 hijos en su casa construida a base de adobe. Haydee se dedica a la agricultura, por está razón posee un terreno de 2 hectáreas en donde tiene plantaciones de cacao orgánico los cuales trabaja junto a su pareja logrando obtener buenas ganancias por la venta final de las almendras secas de cacao. Hace 5 meses decidió poner un pequeño puesto en la esquina de su casa dedicado a la venta de comidas por las noches y hasta el momento tiene buena acogida entre los que vienen a ser sus clientes quienes son principalmente chóferes y pasajeros de un paradero de bus cercano. Comenta que sus comensales la prefieren porque realiza la preparación de los alimentos al instante y con las condiciones adecuadas. Este es su primer crédito con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, ademas se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. En esta ocasión desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para realizar una mejora al techo de su vienda siendo necesario la compra de madera y calaminas.
texts.en:
Haydee is a 35-year-old woman who lives with her husband Eduardo and their 3 children in their house built out of adobe.  Haydee works in agriculture.  For this reason she owns a field of 2 hectares where she has plantings of organic cacao which she works together with her husband managing to obtain good earnings from the final sale of the dried cacao pods.  She decided 5 months ago to put a small spot on the corner of her house dedicated to the sale of food in the evenings and at the moment it is well received among those that come to be her customers who are mainly drivers and passengers form a nearby bus stop.  She says that her guests prefer her because she carries out the preparation of the food instantly and with suitable conditions.  

This is her first loan with Kiva and she feels grateful for the financial support that she is receiving in order to get ahead.  She is also committed to paying her installments in a punctual manner.  On this occasion she wants to have 2,000 nuevos soles (PEN) to make an improvement to the roof of her house for which the purchase of wood and corrugated metal roofing is necessary.

loans.use: to buy wood and corrugated metal roofing.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis tiene 33 años de edad, es casado, tiene una niña de 6 años, actualmente esta esperando su segundo hijo, reside en Tegucigalpa, labora en Offitec, en donde tiene una antigüedad laboral de 8 años. Es egresado de la Universidad Tecnológica de Honduras (UTH), de licenciatura en Gerencia de Negocios. se califica como una persona honestam leal, muy dedicado y temeroso de Dios. Es un joven entusiasta y emprendedor actualmente tiene un negocio propio de creación de páginas web y administra software internacionales para realizar investigaciones de mercados actividades que realiza desde su casa en horas de la noche y fuera de horario laboral. Su interés por conocer las nuevas tendencias en el mundo e innovar en su trabajo y y empresa lo ha llevado a tomar la decisión de continuar sus estudios a nivel de maestría contactando a la Universidad de Autónoma de Barcelona para realizar estudios en Línea es este centro, ha obtenido una beca parcial que incentiva aún mas a iniciar sus estudios. A parte de su superación personal le motiva a continuar sus estudios el desarrollo de su empresa y el deseo de crear nuevas fuentes de trabajo apoyando así a jóvenes con inquietudes  deseos de aprender como él. Una experiencia que me marco en la vida fue " cuando era muy jovencito participe el lo scouts tuve una conversación con uno de los dirigente quien me alentó y motivo a ser una persona de excelencia y a poder compartir y dar a los que necesitan mas de lo que esperan, tiempo de calidad, las mejores cosas materiales y no lo que nos sobre" eso fue una lección que me dio un misión y un compromiso por los demás. Mis planes a corto y mediano plazo son lograr posicionarme en una empresa a nivel de Centroamérica y lograr como persona ser un ejemplo de que los sueños se pueden lograr con esfuerzo y dedicación.
texts.en:
José Luis is 33, married, and has a six-year-old daughter. Currently he is expecting his second child. He lives in Tegucigalpa and works at Offitek, where he has eight years of seniority. He is a graduate of the Technological University of Honduras (UTH), with a bachelor's degree in business administration. 

He is known for being an honest, trustworthy, very dedicated and god-fearing man. He is an enthusiastic and enterprising young man, and currently has his own business creating web pages and running international software to undertake market research. He carries on these activities from his home, in the  hours outside of work and in the evenings. His interest in knowing the new trends in the world and in innovating in his work and business has led him to the decision to continue his studies at the masters level, and he has contacted the Autonomous University of Barcelona to undertake on-line studies at that center. He has obtained a partial scholarship, which gives him even more incentive to begin his studies.

Apart from his desire for self-improvement, the development of his business and the desire to create new sources of work motivates him to continue his education. In this way he can support young people like him, who are restless and have a desire to learn. 

"An experience that made an impression on me in life was when at a very young age I participated in Scouts. I had a conversation with one of the leaders who encouraged me and motivated me to be a person of excellence, able to share and give to those who need more than they expect: quality time, the best material things, and not what is left over. That was a lesson that gave me a mission and a commitment to others. My short and medium-term plans are to succeed in obtaining a position with a Central American level business; and as a person, to become an example of how dreams can be achieved with effort and dedication".

loans.use: To pay for his studies in a Masters of Business Administration program.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 54 years old and lives in Tag-ibo, San Juan, Siquijor. She is married with five children who are of adult and school ages. For the past ten years Marilyn has sold food to earn a living. Each month she earns about 3,000 PHP doing so.

Marilyn is a new member of PMPC. She is applying for a 6,000 PHP loan to buy extra vegetables, meats and spices to sell.

Marilyn hopes to expand her business with the help of PMPC in the future.

loans.use: to buy extra vegetables, meats and spices to sell.

loans.name: Aukusitina

texts.en:
Aukusitina is 21 years old and single with no children. For the past two years she has run a small business selling fast food she makes herself in her community.

Aukusitina joined SPBD this year. She is applying for a 1,000 WST loan to buy flour, chicken, curry, potatoes, sugar, ice bell cordial, oil, onion and carrots. She plans to use her profits to further build her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for the food she makes and sells

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 54 years old, married and has two children who are still in school. For the past ten years she has raised pigs to sell.

Mary Jane has taken out and repaid three loans in the past through NWTF. She is now applying for a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Mary Jane’s ambition is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a farmer and tablea (ground chocolate beans) maker from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and a mother of five children. Tablea refers to blocks of ground cacao beans which, in Filipino cuisine, are heated with milk to make a hot chocolate drink. 

Lucia is asking for a loan to buy more cacao beans for tablea making and fertilizer for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve her output from her tablea making and farming ventures. Lucia has hopes of making her business a success and a stable source of her income.

loans.use: to buy more cacao beans for grinding into tablea (a hot chocolate drink ingredient) and to buy fertilizer for the farm.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita is married with seven children who are of school age. Estrellita is 41 years old and lives in Tag-ibo, San Juan, Siquijor. Estrellita is engaged in a hog-raising activity to earn a living and has had this business for two years. Each month, she earns 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) doing this type of work. 

She has requested a loan amounting to 9,000 PHP to purchase additional piglets and feeds. Estrellita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Estrellita hopes to expand her business with this institution.

loans.use: To purchase additional piglets and feeds.

loans.name: Eufracia

texts.en:
From Masabud, Clarin, Philippines, is a PMPC member named Eufracia. She is 65 years old and married with five children. 

Eufracia is a farmer and grows rice crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional fertilizers and chemicals.

Eufracia has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Eufracia hopes to financially support her immediate family members.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers and chemicals.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 50 years old and married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elena has a fishing business in the Philippines. Elena requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing net and other materials for her business.

Elena has been in this business for five years. Elena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other materials for her business

loans.name: Zokirjon

texts.ru: Зокирчону 47 лет. Он живет в районе Шахритус. У него жена, двое сыновей и одна дочь. Зокирчон имеет высшее образование. Он по профессии бухгалтер. Сейчас Зокирчон намерен заняться торговым бизнесом. Он в своем селе построил помещение размером 10х4 метров для магазина, в котором собирается продавать продукты питания и хозяйственные товары. У него на руках осталось 1500 долларов США. Однако этой суммы недостаточно, чтобы закупить весь товар для магазина. Поэтому Зокирчон за поддержкой обратился в организацию ХУМО. Он планирует оптом привозить свежий и качественный товар с города Душанбе и продавать по розничной цене в своем магазине. Он считает что его торговля будет успешной, так как он будет предлагать жителям широкий ассортимент необходимых продуктов питания и хозяйственных товаров. Он ждет поддержки, чтобы открыть магазин.
texts.en: Zokirjon is 47 years old. He lives in the Shahrituz Region. He is married and has two sons and one daughter. Zokirjon has a college degree. He is a professional accountant. At present Zokirjon intends to launch a retail business. He has built a store, 10x4 meters [about 33’ x13’ ], in his village and plans to sell groceries and household goods there. He has 1,500 USD remaining. This sum is insufficient to stock up merchandise for the shop. This is why Zokrijon turned to the MLO Humo for support. He plans to buy fresh quality groceries wholesale in the city of Dushanbe and bring them to his shop for retailing. He believes that his business will be successful because he will offer a wide selection of first necessity food items and household goods. He is counting on your support to open his store.

loans.use: to buy groceries and household good in order to launch his store.

loans.name: Mchicha Group

texts.en:
Hassani, who is in his mid 30s, is married with three children, two of whom go to school while the other one is still small. Hassani has been running a barber shop for five years now. He works from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is his third loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to open another barber shop in another place. Hassani used the previous loans to buy a barber shop machine, chair and other working equipment. Hassani has paid back all his previous loan successfully. With the business returns received, he managed to cover household expenses and school fees. He also bought a TV and fridge. Hassani dreams that one day, he will be able to buy land and build a house. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Mchicha," which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying the loan.

loans.use: to open another barber shop in another place.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 36 years old and has one child in school. She has been raising pigs for ten years and earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables.

Helen is applying for a 120,00 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to send her child to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jocilyn

texts.en:
Jocilyn is 41 years old and lives in Tag-ibo, San Juan, Siquijor. She is married and has six school-aged children.

For the past eight years Jocilyn has raised pigs to help support the family. She earns about 3,000 PHP monthly doing so.

Jocilyn is a new member of PMPC. She is applying for a 9,000 PHP loan to buy additional piglets and feed for them. She hopes to continue growing her business with the help of PMPC.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for several years now. She lives with her husband in the town of CPG, Bohol. 

Marissa is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and a new engine for the fishing boat. With this loan, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. In the future, Marissa has hopes of expanding their business so that it will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and a new engine for the fishing boat.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is married and works hard to support her family. For the past ten years she has been involved in a furniture-making business in the Philippines.

Mary Jane is applying for a 23,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. for the business. She would like to save enough money to expand the venture.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. for her business

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es:
Alexandra, es madre soltera y vive solo con sus tres hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 8, 13 y 25 años, todos dependen de ella. La Sra. Alexandra se dedica a la venta de verduras, lo desempeña todos los días y en el mercado, lo realiza de 4:00am hasta 11:00am.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar verduras, tales como: rábano, yuca, plátanos, tomates, chiles, cebollas, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar sus utilidades y su calidad de vida.
Su sueño es adquirir su propia casa para vivir más estables y cómodos.
texts.en:
Alexandra is unmarried and lives alone with her three children, who are 8, 13, and 25 years old. She is financially responsible for all of them.
Alexandra sells vegetables every day in the market from 4 a.m. to 11 a.m.
This loan will allow her to buy vegetables such as radishes, cassava, plantains, tomatoes, chilies, onions, and so forth.
This investment will help her increase her profits and improve her quality of life.
Her dream is to acquire her own house so that she and her family can be more stable and comfortable.

loans.use: to buy radishes, cassava, plantains, tomatoes, chilies, onions, and so forth.

loans.name: Lemalie

texts.en:
Lemalie is a 40-year-old married woman with seven children. She runs a small business selling fast foods in her community and has been doing this for many years. 

Lemalie has requested a loan to buy a kerosene oven, big basins, a sack of raw taro, yams, bananas, chicken and curry. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Lemalie will improve her business and save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a kerosene oven, big basins, a sack of raw taro, yams, bananas, chicken and curry.

loans.name: Aiza

texts.en:
Aiza is a 24-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has four children. The oldest is 5 while the youngest is only 1 month old. She engages in fishing. She catches and sells fish. She has been selling fish for almost five years. Her husband is also a fisherman. They work hand in hand to support their family. 

She requested a loan of 3,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy fishing materials like fishing net, food for the family and school supplies. In the future, Aiza would like to expand her fishing business to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing net, food for the family and school supplies.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 49 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Hilda is borrowing 11,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Hilda has been farming rice for 32 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling gasoline.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa cuenta con 42 años de edad, es madre soltera de un hija de 14 años. Ella estudio hasta noveno grado.
se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. Junto a sus hija a quien enviá a la escuela; mientras ella se dedica actividades comerciales de productos de primera necesidad (tienda), oficio que aprendió de su madre; productos que comercializa en su residencia y alrededores
El préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar dos vacas que le venden para producir leche y elaborar queso. De esta manera, dispondrá de productos lácteos para ofrecerlos a los cliente que lleguen a comprar a su negocio lo que incrementara sus ingresos para el sustento de ella y su hija
En un futuro desea, enviar a su hija a la universidad para que sea una profesional y una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Rosa, 42, is the single mother of a daughter, 14.  She studied up to ninth grade.

She gets up at 5 a.m. with her daughter, who attends school while Rosa works selling staples in her store at home and in the area.  She learned the job from her mother.

The loan she's requesting is to buy two cows so she can obtain milk and make cheese.  This way she'll have dairy products to sell to the customers who shop in her business.  This will increase her income for supporting herself and her daughter.

In the future she wants to send her daughter to the university so she can become a professional and an honest person.

loans.use: to buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling live crabs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 29,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase additional live crabs to sell for her business.

Luisa has been in this business for eight years. Luisa earns more income from raising pigs.

Luisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional live crabs to sell.

loans.name: Kerana

texts.en:
Kerana is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional bananas to sell for her buy-and-sell banana business.

Kerana has been in this business for nine years. Kerana earns more income from farming coconut.

Kerana has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas to sell.

loans.name: Lie

texts.en:
Lie is 40 years old and married with four children.

Lie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional items like rice, eggs, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell.

Lie has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Lie aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like rice, eggs, sugar, shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Fuaselau

texts.en:
Fuaselau is a 34-year-old married woman with three children. She has a small vegetable garden and grows different vegetables to sell in her community or at the market. To earn extra income, she has a pork cake business also. She has been doing this for many years. 

Fuaselau has requested a loan to buy flour, yeast, baking soda, big basins, an oven, chicken, soy sauce, fertilizer, vegetable seeds and a garden hose. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. With her profits, Fuaselau hopes to improve her businesses to earn good money.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, baking soda, big basins, an oven, chicken, soy sauce, fertilizer, vegetable seeds and a garden hose.

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en: Petronila is 28 years old and she is married. She has four children. She has a kiosk to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan, and now she is applying for her second loan of $1,500. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as water, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, milk, oil, noodles, body lotion and biscuits. She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: To buy water, cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, milk, oil and noodles.

loans.name: Taimane

texts.en:
Taimane is 51 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling fish in her community and has been doing this for many years.

Taimane has requested a loan to buy fishing net, fishing bait, a diving mask, fishing line and a new canoe. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Taimane will improve her business to get good income.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, fishing bait, a diving mask, fishing line and a new canoe.

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto earns a living through his motorcycle transport business in his place in CPG, Bohol. He is a married man and a father of two children. Roberto has been in the business for more than 20 years now. 

Roberto is asking for a loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle such as nuts and bolts, chains and tires. Roberto is optimistic that this loan could help him improve and maintain the good working condition of his motorcycle. Roberto has hopes of experiencing the fullness of life together with his family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle such as nuts and bolts, chains and tires.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a farmer from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for more than 30 years now. This is the source of her income. 

Wilma is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor costs for the farm. With this loan, she will be able to improve the productivity of her farm, thus increasing her yield and profit. Wilma has hopes of expanding her business and making it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money to pay the school expenses of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides and to pay the labor costs for the farm.

loans.name: Moana

texts.en: Moana is 74 years old and married with no children. She makes and sells weaving bags, mats and hats to earn a living and has been doing this for many years. Moana has requested a loan to buy dry pandana leaves, a knife, a big basin, materials and colored paints for design. She plans to use her profits to improve her current business and be able to make more money from it . She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy dry pandana leaves, a knife, a big basin, materials and colored paints for design

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is offered to Rita to improve her business. She opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer), noodles, sugar, milk, water, eggs, slippers and soap. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks (Fanta, Coca-Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), hard drinks (beer), noodles, sugar, milk, water, eggs, slippers and soap.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
As a married parent of 4 children, Ester works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.  Ester is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to  buy items to sell such as shampoo, spices, egg, milk and soap for her general store business.

Ester has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, spices, egg, milk and soap

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 60 years old, married and has three children. 

Nida is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Nida requested a loan of PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Nida has been raising livestock for 8 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Malie

texts.en:
Malie is a mother of five children who is requesting a loan for the first time to build an irrigation system. She and her family live in a rural village in the south-central part of the country where she operates an agricultural type of family business; she has been photographed inside the plantation of plums. 
She grows delicious plums and sells them to wholesale buyers. “At first, I planted orchards and later on, I added some more of them. The sales of my fresh produce have been going very well since the third year after the establishment, and I have no complaints. The fruits that aren’t sold at the end of the season, I dry them in the sun and sell them dried. Either way the market is good” Malie said smiling.

loans.use: to build an irrigation system

loans.name: Telesia

texts.en: Telesia is a 78-year-old woman who is married with six children. She has a small business of pig farming. She has many years with this business. Telesia needs a loan to buy barbed wire, boots, cement, a water hose and coconuts. She will use her profits to help support her family financially. Telesia joined SPBD in 2007 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, boots, cement, a water hose and coconuts

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Hay is 36 years old and a resident of Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is married and has six children of various ages, three of whom are still in her care. She works alongside her husband, producing rice on their own land for their basic subsistence. They have been working in this occupation for more than 20 years and together earn approximately KHR 14,000 per day.

Hay needs money to concrete around her well to prevent the land from absorbing the water back into the land, which can affect the water quality. For this reason, she is applying for a loan to buy sand and cement and to pay for labor costs. Finally, she indicates that with this loan they will be able to gain access to clean water for the consumption and advance their sanitation.

loans.use: to buy sand and cement and to pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Heni

texts.en:
Heni is a 50-year-old married woman with 5 children. She has a small plantation and grows taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Heni has requested a loan to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, a spade, bush knives, a file and a wheelbarrow. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Heni hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a backpack sprayer, chemicals, a spade, bushknives, a file and a wheelbarrow

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 33 years old and married with 2 children. She owns and operates a small store selling items such as daily products, beer, cigarettes and meats. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Maria needs a loan to buy sugar, flour, onions, chicken, herring, corned beef, milk, cigarettes, snacks and mosquito coils to stock her store. She hopes to use her profits to improve her business. She became a member of SPBD in 2010 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, onions, chicken, herring, corned beef, milk, cigarettes, snacks and mosquito coils for her store.

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is a 41 year old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has 4 children - the eldest is 24 years old and the youngest is 18 years old. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various items ranging from cooking oil, eggs, noodles, bananas, squash, coconut wine and soft drinks. She has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store for more than 5 years. 

Belinda has requested a loan of 6000 Phillipine peso (PHP) to buy a sack of rice, pollard (pig feed) and other various goods to fill her store with more supplies and attract more customers. In the future, Belinda would like to improve her business to provide her children with a good quality education.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, pollard (pig feed) and other various goods for her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Modelia

texts.en:
Modelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a blacksmith business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 25,000 Phillipine pesos through NWTF to buy materials such as iron, sacks of charcoal and wood for her blacksmith business.

Modelia has been in this business for 7 years. Modelia earns additional income from a general store.

Modelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like iron, sacks of charcoal and wood for her blacksmith business.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is 59 years old and a widow with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. Nieves is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Nieves has been pig fattening for 20 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rose Mae

texts.en:
Rose Mae is 30 years old and married with two children who are in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rose Mae is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Rose Mae has been raising pigs for three years and earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia has a kiosk where many people come to buy goods every day. With a $700 loan Rosalia will improve her business. She will buy some additional supplies for her kiosk such as cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, noodles, oils and biscuits. 

Rosalia has been involved in business activities since 2007. She feels very content running her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Rosalia independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies such as cigarettes, sugar, salt, coffee, noodles and oils for her kiosk.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 38-year-old mother, married to Patrick with three children aged 10, 8 and 6 respectively. All her children attend school and she helps her husband when it comes to paying school fees. She also takes care of her house helper.

Betty owns a small mobile shop which deals in the sale of bags and bedding in Kibale district and she has approached Ugafode for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings to buy more stock to sell and she promises to pay it back after the sale of the items.

Betty's dream is to see all her children complete their studies in order to live a happy life. However, she faces challenges like limited sources of income because her additional income comes from agriculture which is too seasonal and unpredictable.

She thanks Kiva for partnering with her.

loans.use: To buy bags and bedding to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inventory to sell at her rental counter

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Em, aged 46, is a resident of Prey Chor district, where she lives with her family of six members. She is involved in farming and together with the help of her husband they cultivate the land and plant rice on their farm. The income from farming is not enough to support their living needs, so her husband also operates a service-based business providing transportation for supplementary income.

A loan of 600 US dollars, which she has applied for from HKL and Kiva, will be favorable to allow her to bring out a better harvest by keeping her crop in good condition and applying farming supplies needed accordingly. She will use the loan to hire people to help plow her rice paddy and to buy fertilizer. She is very thankful to Kiva lenders for trusting her with a big loan. She hopes her business will be successful and have a good harvest someday.

loans.use: to hire people to help plow her rice paddy and to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Miraslan

texts.en: Miraslan is married and a father of two children aged four and six years old. He works as a camera operator at weddings and other events. From childhood he has loved to shoot video footage and eight years ago he decided to turn his hobby into a professional activity. Now this work is his only source of financial income. Miraslan takes responsibility for his work and he needs to buy a new video camera for better filming.

loans.use: to purchase a new video camera for better filming.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of frozen foods to sell for her buying and selling of frozen foods business.

Sarah has been in this business for 20 years. Sarah earns more income from selling ready to wear items.

Sarah has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Grace's Group

texts.en:
Grace's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Grace is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past two years, Grace has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells posho, rice, and sugar. 

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase soap, posho, and rice for the shop to sell and will help Grace to generate greater profits and to boast the business. Grace hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy land and build a home. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.



"

loans.use: to purchase soap, posho and rice to sell,

loans.name: Sabri

texts.en:
Sabri is 30 years old, recently married and lives in a village with his wife. He is working for an electrical company, earning a very small salary and his wife is a housewife. In order to earn additional income, he also works in the agricultural business. 

Sabri owns a cow and uses and sells the milk it produces. Recently, he has managed to renovate the stable, which was very old, but he is requesting a loan in order to complete the roof on his stable. Sabri is a very hard worker and he works a lot to have a better life for his future. His goal is to improve his situation in order to offer his family a better life. In the future, he plans to invest more and increase the number of cows he owns. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he wants to thank all the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To renovate the roof of his stable

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 40 years old and married with three children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Thelma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, spices, eggs, etc.

Thelma has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future Thelma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, spices, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Lilia Group

texts.en:
Linda is the featured borrower of the Lilia Group. Linda and the other members of Lilia Group have been friends since they came from their home country of the Philippines to work as housekeepers in order to provide for their families. The group got together to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua.

Linda is a 41-year-old mother of two children, she works as a housekeeper to provide her family with the best living possible. Linda is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to send money home to cover her children's needs. Linda is thankful that she is dealing with Al Majmoua, because it provides an important additional source of financial support that easily meets their needs.

Linda is the lady standing at the far left side of the picture. As for the other group members, Marylyn is in the middle and Elizabeth is the lady at the right wearing pink.

loans.use: cover her children's needs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace his car

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is married with one child, and her child doesn’t go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. She works from home seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and on-and-off electricity. She is aspiring to own a fully-stocked beauty salon and also to invest in selling used shoes. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Meiema

texts.en: Meiema is a 29-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Meiema has requested a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, barbed wire, a wheelbarrow, a spade, and a bush-knife. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits, Meiema hopes to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, barbed wires, a wheelbarrow, a spade, and a bush-knife for her farming business.

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past one year, Moreen has been working hard to manage her fresh food business.  

To help expand her business, Moreen has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase matooke, potatoes, and onions; it will help Moreen to generate greater profits and expand the business. Moreen hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business and buy land. 

Moreen is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase matooke, potatoes, and onions for her food stall business.

loans.name: Afërdita

texts.en:
Afërdita is married and 42 years old. She lives only with her husband in the southern part of Kosovo as her daughter is married and lives with her own husband. Her son died many years ago in a car accident. Even to this day, she always has a pain for her son that she lost. Afërdita operates a handicraft business from her home and reports that doing this type of work helps her to forget the pain that she had for a long time. 

She has been working for over 10 years now making traditional handicraft items and has been sustaining her business through her own efforts. She is very professional and she has many requests from her customers. Afërdita is requesting a loan through KosInvest in order to purchase various materials for her work. She hopes to expand her business in the future and be able to open her own shop outside of her home. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she really appreciates this support!

loans.use: To purchase various materials for her handicraft business.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en: Teddy is married with three children; two of her children go to school. She has a business of a restaurant and has been in this business for 18 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of beer and jerry-cans of local gin. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She works in a shop seven days out of every week and sells on wholesale. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She is aspiring to own a fully-stocked pub and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerry-cans of local gin for her pub business.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver is married with three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business of selling used shoes. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used clothes. She works from home and sells on retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She generates additional income by selling beer. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is married with no children but takes care of additional family members (grand mother). She has a food stall business and has been in this business for one year. She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas and sweet potatoes. She generates additional income by selling piped water. She works at the market six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She is aspiring to sell on wholesale only and also to buy a plot of land to build a house. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying for electricity and piped water.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of green bananas.

loans.name: Faatagi

texts.en:
Faatagi is 62 years old and is married with eight children. She has a small garden where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for many years. 

Faatagi needs a loan to buy taro roots, chemicals, a backpack sprayer, a wheelbarrow, a digging stick and a pick. She has been a member of SPBD since 2008. Faatagi will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy taro roots, chemicals, a backpack sprayer, a wheelbarrow, a digging stick and a pick.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 52 years old and is from the town of Chiatura in the Imereti Region. She is married and the mother of two grown sons. Tamar’s retired sister-in-law lives with them. Tamar graduated from pedagogical college and works as a music teacher at the local music school. Tamar’s young son is a cook at the restaurant and earns a small salary. Unfortunately, their income is too small and hardly enough to cover food and every day expenses for the family of five. 

So, Tamar decided to start a clothing-trading business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Tamar’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she doesn’t satisfy their requirements. She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, called the Startup Program that gives vulnerable poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of $600, she will purchase clothing at a wholesale price and sell them in her community door-to-door. Her regular customers will be her coworkers and neighbors. She plans to sell a wide assortment and well-priced clothing for men, women and children. It is obvious that the job is hard for Tamar, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The start-up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased with regards to Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Marhamat

texts.en:
Marhamat is 44 years old. She is a married parent of one child. Her husband is a driver. She is busy in her business where she provides wedding dresses for hire. She has been busy with this business for more than two years. She began her business with animal sales. Now her business is going well. She has her store at her home. She lives in village and there is no business competition in her village. 

As there is a great demand for wedding dresses, she wants to increase her working capital and in this way to develop her business. She is asking for a loan of 3,000 USD to buy wedding dresses. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy wedding dresses.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a single mother of one child and her only child goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling roasted maize and has been in this business for three years. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells to all categories of people but on retail basis. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more baskets of maize. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to own a plot of land so as to start growing maize and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of maize.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 18 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo in the Mubende region of Uganda. For the past two years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and soap.

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase beans and millet flour to sell, and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and to expand the business. Agnes hopes that in the future she will be able to help her family.

Agnes is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase beans and millet flour to sell.

loans.name: La

texts.en: La is a 52-year-old woman married with six children. She has a taxi business. She has been doing it for many years. La is requesting this loan to buy tires, seat covers, and a car fuel pump, and pay for a taxi license renewal. She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services. With her profits, La will save for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy tires, seat covers, and a car fuel pump, and pay for a taxi license renewal.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov is 44 years old, widowed, and has four children of various ages; two of whom are still in school. She is in the agricultural business, growing rice and raising hogs, in a peaceful village of Baray district, Kompong Tom province. The two businesses earn her an average of KHR 50,000 per day to feed her family. She has been engaged in agriculture for about 24 years.

She requested a KHR 2,500,000 loan through HKL branch office, to purchase 10 hogs for fattening and to buy feed for them. She hopes to sell her pigs and earn a good profit within four or five months upon maturity.
