In the future, she would like to save enough money to advance her business and build a suitable house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase 10 hogs for fattening for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a felt cover and other materials to insulate his Ger in order to stay warm with less consumption of coal and firewood during the harsh Mongolian winter.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is a 34-year-old married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has six children.The oldest child is 11 while the youngest is one. She engages in fishing. She catches and sells fish. She has been selling fish for more than five years. 

She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy a fishing net, floater and nylon, to improve her catch and augment her income. In the future,Emelita hopes that her fishing business will prosper to support the education of her children as well as provide good food.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net, floater and nylon.

loans.name: Al Kinan Group

texts.en:
Amira is the featured borrower of Al Kinan group. She joined with her other group members to acquire a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Amira is a 26-year-old married mother of one child, who works as a hair dresser to help her husband in making their living and cover their child's expenses. She is a hard worker who puts in a lot of effort to support both her husband and business at the same time, to make sure that everything is going just fine. 

Amira's acquired loan will be invested in increasing her hair color collection, and buying a new hair cutting chair to improve and develop her work easily. She is the one seated in the middle. As for the other group members, Renee is the one on the far left of the picture, and Layal is the one seated on the right.

loans.use: to increase her hair color collection, and buy a new hair cutting chair to improve and develop her work.

loans.name: Bela

texts.en:
Bela is 30 years old, living in the Vani district with her retired mother and three children (10, 13 and 14 years old). Bela is widowed. She runs a small-scale agricultural business to earn a living and feed her children. She grows maize, straw and nuts on the small plot of land and sells them seasonally. Bela’s mother gets a retirement pension from the government and the family receives a small amount of social assistance as they live below the poverty line. Their existing income is modest and not enough to cover their everyday costs. 

That’s why Bela decided to start up a trading business with a loan but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Bela’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she didn’t satisfied their requirements. 

She received a credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo, the so-called Start-up Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With this loan of 1,000 GEL (Georgian Lari) she will purchase clothing at wholesale prices and sell them in her community with a price mark-up. She hopes that she will attract many customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. Bela will earn a monthly income to feed her orphans properly and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start a clothes-trading business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is married with two children and only one child goes to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling used shoes and has been in this business for three years.  

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of used shoes. She works seven days out of every week. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. 

She aspires to start importing used shoes and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in the family house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expense includes school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used shoes.

loans.name: Akenese

texts.en:
Akenese is a 50-year-old married woman with six children. She makes and sells cakes in her community to earn a living. She has many years of experience with this business. 

Akenese needs a loan to buy a refrigerator, flour, sugar, eggs, butter, baking soda, yeast and whipping cream. She plans to use her profits to support her family. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, flour, sugar, eggs, butter, baking soda, yeast and whipping cream.

loans.name: Kristina

texts.en:
Kristina is an Egyptian Albanian who lives in a main city in south eastern Albania. Her children are grown ups, the youngest one is 21 years old. 

For the past five years, Kristina has been running an alterations and clothing repair activity from her own home, serving mostly residents in her neighborhood. 

Here it is what Krisitina said to the loan officer during the interview: “I am 52 now and sometime back I decided to do something to earn an income and the only thing I knew how to do well, was stitching. I would loose nothing, because I would run it from home, so, I gave it a try. And I am glad I did. I have been able to earn a bit of money since then, with some days more and some days less.”

Kristina now wants to buy some raw materials for her activity and this loan will be her second one.

loans.use: to buy raw fabric materials and other necessary items for her clothing alterations activity.

loans.name: Rano

texts.en:
A beautiful woman by the name Rano, lives in a house which is in bad condition. Her husband is a kind man who is an invalid. They have three clever children aged 16, 15 and 7. Rano’s children want to live in a house which is in good condition, but her salary is not enough for it. 

She has worked at a school for more than ten years. She must repair all of the rooms as her house is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 1500 Somoni to repair her house. 

In this way, she will be able to offer her family a better quality of life and moral stability that will allow them to progress. She awaits your support and mercy.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single mother of two children, one of whom goes to school. 

She has business of a food stall and has been in this business for three years. She generates additional income through washing people clothes. 

She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy more sacks of green banana fingers, tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes and oranges. 

Margaret works from home and sells to all categories of people on retail basis seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of green banana fingers, tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes and oranges.

loans.name: Fiapalagi

texts.en:
Fiapalagi is 33 years old and is married with seven children. 

She would like to start a small business - an elei (fabric printing) business. In order to do this, Fiapalagi needs a loan to buy materials, colour paints, stencils, brushes and carved wooden design. She hopes to use her profits to maintain her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy materials, colour paints, stencils, brushes and carved wooden design.

loans.name: Bazarragchaa

texts.en:
Bazarragchaa is 46 years old and lives with her daughter in a Ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in the Uvs province of Mongolia. Her daughter Saranchimeg is 17 years old and is a sophomore student at university. 

Bazarragchaa has been running her clothes retail business at a rental counter of a local market since 2000. She has also been growing organic sea-buckthorn trees and produces juice out of them. She has been paying her daughter's university tuition from her profits and gets her well educated. 

She is now requesting a loan of 5,500,000MNT to pay her daughter's tuition fees and purchase clothing inventory to sell at her rental counter. She is thinking of building a small house for her and her daughter to live on their plot of land, and has started saving for it. She is a hardworking, welcoming and friendly woman.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees and purchase clothing inventory to sell at her rental counter.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is married with two children who both go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister). 

She has a dry cleaning business, and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more jerry cans of liquid soap, an electric flat iron and powdered soap. She doesn’t have any other income generating activity.

Beatrice works from home six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include thieves and defaulters. She aspires of building her own commercial premises to accommodate her business and also to buy a washing machine. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more jerry cans of liquid soap, an electric flat iron and powdered soap.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Yem is 65 years old and is a farmer who lives in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She is married with eight children of various ages, five of whom have already married. Farming has been her main source of income for years, by planting and harvesting rice and soybean on their lots, which she and her husband inherited from their parents.

Yem is seeking a loan to cover the cost of land preparation for planting rice and soybean, and to buy farming supplies needed for her crops. Through the loan support, she hopes to grow an abundant harvest in order to earn more income to improve the living situation of the family.

loans.use: to cover the cost of land preparation for planting rice and soybean, and to buy farming supplies needed for her crops.

loans.name: Falasten

texts.en:
Falasten is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo. 

Falasten is a 28-year-old married woman from Jabalia. She lives with her husband and their three children. Falasten's husband is a worker in the public sector and gets a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. 

Falasten and her husband would like to improve their housing conditions by buying appliances. She took a $1,000 USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy living room furniture. This will improve the house conditions and provide a comfortable living.

loans.use: to buy living room furniture for the family home.

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.en:
Hanifa is married with three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mummy). 

She has a restaurant business and has been in this business for one year. She generates additional income through selling shoes. She works at the market seven days out of every week. 

Hanifa has applied for a loan of 200000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, fish, Irish potatoes and rice. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. 

She aspires of owning a fully stocked restaurant and also to get enough profits so as to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas, beef, fish, Irish potatoes and rice.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 45-year-old woman with a family of five, four of whom are already finished with their studies. She is a public servant and has been a head teacher for the last ten years, and 25 years as a teacher. Alongside teaching, Betty supplements her salary with agriculture production, especially coffee.

Betty believes that with this opportunity from Ugafode to advance to her a loan facility, the future is bright. According to her, she is described as a honest and hard working woman who has educated her children up to a university level.

She has three acres of coffee plantation and through this, a lot has been achieved, such as paying tuition fees for all her children who have graduated through university level and her studies as well.

Betty has acquired this facility in order to add fertilizers to her coffee plantation and to buy coffee plants for planting in the rainy season. Her biggest problem affecting coffee production is vagaries of weather, especially the dry season that leaves coffee plants dry and also coffee pests.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Tuong

texts.en:
Tuong is 44 years old, and is single. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. He earns an income running a food stall. He started this business four years ago. 

Tuong is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying new furniture and a food cabinet to better satisfy his customers and attract more new customers. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and a food cabinet.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is a 60-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is now retired. Dung earns money by running a food stall in front of her house, where she sells rice roll cake to people in her community.

Dung would like a loan to purchase a motorcycle and pans for making rice roll cake. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle and a new pan for making rice roll cake.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is married with three children, two of whom go to school. 

She has a business of selling maize, and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy more baskets of maize. She generates additional income through selling green bananas. She works at the market six days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. 

Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She aspires of growing maize and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of maize to re-sell.

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en: Jalal is a married man from Jabalia. He is the father of a young son. Jalal works as a taxi driver in the city. He does not get a high income, so he tries to work extra hours to cover all the family needs. Jalal took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop to read articles and news, and also to connect with his relatives outside Palestine. Jalal appears in the photo in the computer store.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his personal use

loans.name: Thoa

texts.en:
Thoa is 49 years old and is widowed. She has one son and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Thoa runs a food stall that sell beverages to people in her commmunity. She intends to use her loan to buy a juicer and repair her old motorcycle.

She hope her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for facing difficulty in future.

loans.use: to buy a juicer and repair her old motorcycle.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en:
Nam, aged 64, is married. He has five children and lives with them and his wife in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Nam and his wife started running a general store 30 years ago. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying a greater quantity of food products to stock his store and better satisfy his customers. He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of food products to stock his store.

loans.name: Danijela

texts.en:
Danijela is 42 years old, divorced and has two adult sons. She lives in a minority community. Danijela is currently staying home and receives a social pension. She has had a very difficult life because she had to raise two children on her own, as she has been divorced for more than 15 years now. The family's main income comes from her sons who are working as construction workers.
 
Danijela’s family has had a problem with their bathroom for a long time and doesn't have the money for repairs. The money that her sons earn through their work is not enough to pay for the repairs. Therefore, Danijela is requesting a 1200 EUR loan to repair the bathroom that is built in an annex of the house. 

Danijela and her family thank Kiva lenders for their help and for helping them improve their family’s living conditions. She hopes for her children to have a better future and to get married. She also promises to be punctual in making her payments.

loans.use: to repair the bathroom that is built in an annex of the house.

loans.name: Buyanbadrah

texts.en: Mr. Buyanbadrah is 25 years old lives with his wife and a daughter in a ger, traditional nomadic tent, in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife Tungalagtamir is currently staying home taking care of their new born baby girl Hulan, who is one year old. Buyanbadrah has graduated from a specialized training college and works at construction company. The construction season stops during the Mongolian cold winters, and he started providing a taxi service business in town to increase his income to cover his family expenses. He has been living in rented land and now requesting loan of 6,500,000 MNT, he wants to purchase plot of land to live in with his family and purchase insulation material and a stove to improve his ger to reduce coal and firewood consumption during winter. He is a hardworking, responsible, and honest man.

loans.use: to purchase plot of land to live in with his family and purchase insulation material and stove to improve his Ger to reduce coal and firewood consumption during winter.

loans.name: El Shadai Group

texts.es: El grupo está conformado por tres socias microempresarias una de ellas es Karla es una mujer muy trabajadora de 29 años, vive en unión libre, con dos hijos bajo su cargo. Su negocio es la venta de cosméticos por catálogos de Avon desde hace 1 año, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosméticos como perfumes, labiales, sombras, lencerías, etc. Josefa mujer de 32 años de edad ella se dedica al negocio de la venta de frutas y tiene una mini pulpería ubicada en su domicilio y Gloria mujer de 26 años de edad y su negocio es la venta de frutas
texts.en: The group is made up of three female members with microbusinesses. One of them is Karla. She is a very hard-working woman of 29 years of age. She is in a common law marriage, with two children in her charge. Her business is selling cosmetics from Avon catalogues. She has been doing this for one year. She is requesting the loan in order to purchase cosmetics, such as perfume, lipstick, eye shadow, and lingerie. 32-year-old Josefa makes a living by selling fruit and has a mini grocery store located in her home. 26-year-old Gloria has a business selling fruit.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, lipsticks, eye shadows, lingerie, etc.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is a 51-year-old divorced woman. She lives with one son in Ho Chi Minh City. Phuong earns money by running a business of sewing and selling clothes.

Phuong would like a loan to purchase a sewing machine and cloth to increase her production of clothes and satisfy her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and cloth to increase her production of clothes.

loans.name: Luc

texts.en:
Luc is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as snack food and household items, to restock his general store. This purchase will help him to better meet the needs of his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business and offer his customers a greater variety of products.

He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his store and increase sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as snack food and and household items.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is a 45-year-old married woman with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Thu and her husband support their family by running a food stall in front of their house. She has been running her business for the past 5 years. 

Thu would like to receive a loan to purchase new bowls, plates, and chopsticks, as well as more food to sell. She hopes that this will enable her to earn a higher income, improve her family's living conditions, and set aside some savings for family emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new bowls, plates, chopsticks and food.

loans.name: Fares

texts.en:
Fares is a 28 year-old single man; he lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He has been operating a phone accessories business for three years. He started with a small amount to establish his business. As his clientele has grown, he has added a greater variety of merchandise, and his sales have increased. Today his business has faithful clientele that refer new customers to him. 

He is requesting a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to purchase greater quantities of phone accessories like mobiles, mobile recharge cards, mobile covers etc. These items have a fast turnover, and the resulting profits will enable him to expand his enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase greater quantities of phone accessories like mobiles, mobile recharge cards, mobile covers, etc. for his retail business.

loans.name: Aza

texts.en:
Aza is 52 years old, and is from the small town of Ambrolauri. She lives with her spouse who works as a driver for a private company and gets a monthly salary. Aza co-ordinates newspaper kiosks located in her town and earns a monthly salary as well. 

Unfortunately, her existing income is not enough to cover everyday costs and also help her children living in the village near the town where Aza lives. So, Aza decided to start a clothing trading business with a loan. But the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. Aza’s credit requests were rejected several times, as she doesn’t satisfy their requirements. 

She received credit within the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The Startup Program gives vulnerable poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. With the loan of 3,000 USD, she will purchase second-hand clothing at wholesale prices and sell it in her community. She will renovate a commercial space and set up a store to offer her customers a wide assortment and well-priced clothing for men, women and children. 

It is obvious that the job is hard for Aza, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her trading business gradually. The startup credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to set up a used clothing store.

loans.name: Suzan

texts.en:
Suzan is a 25-year-old single lady who has been working selling bags and accessories since June 2012. Her business is going on just fine although her house is her business center, and she still needs additional financial support to expand her business with a newly released collection.

Suzan is applying for a YOUTH loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with bags from a newly released collection.
She is very excited about this loan, and although it is her first loan cycle, she is preparing successful future plans.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with bags from a newly released collection.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Couturière de profession, Akouavi est mariée à un revendeur. Elle  est mère de famille. En plus de son activité, elle revend des produits de mercerie et sollicite son quatrième crédit pour s'approvisionner en marchandises. Madame Akouavi espère avec le profit avoir une bonne de vie et rendre pérenne son activité.
texts.en: Akouavi is a seamstress by trade. She is married to a salesman. She is also a mother. In addition to her activity she also sells haberdashery items and requests this fourth loan for the purchase of stock. Mrs Akouavi hopes to improve her situation and to give stability to her business.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing supplies

loans.name: Mastula

texts.en:
Mastula is a single mother of two children, who both go to school. 

She has a business selling tomatoes and onions and has been in this business for 10 years. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and perishabilty. Mastula has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy more boxes of tomatoes and onions. 


Mastula doesn’t have any other income generating activity. She aspires of becoming a wholesaler and also opening up a retail shop, and building her own house. She currently resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of tomatoes and onions to sell at the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make felt underlining and blankets.

loans.name: Dorina

texts.en:
Dorina is a married woman and a mother of two young children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She has been engaged in a fishing business together with her husband for more than seven years now. She also runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items.

Dorina is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and additional stock for her store like rice, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages and others. Through this, Dorina will be able to improve her store thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and additional stock for her store like rice, soap and toiletries, soda and beverages and others.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en: Anabelle earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her place. She lives with her family in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She has been in the business for more than a year now. Anabelle is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, candies, soda and beverages. With this, she will be able to improve the diversity of her stocks thus attracting more buyers to her store. In the future, Anabelle hopes to make her business a success and sustainable. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell such as canned goods, candies, soda and beverages for her general store business.

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy is requesting a new loan to expand her business by buying a sewing maching and more fabric to make a greater quantity of clothes for selling.  

Thuy's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will enable her to increase her business turnover and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric to make clothes for selling.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en: Dung is requesting a new loan to buy better quality food for his food stall. This purchase will help him to better attract and satisfy his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his food stall and increasing sales, and will also help him to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality food for his food stall.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
Sang, 54, is married and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She has three children. She and her husband earn an income running a general store in front of their house. 

Sang started this business fifteen years ago. She would like to take loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her existing customers and attract additional customers. She also hopes that through the loan her business will generate a higher income and enable her to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to stock her general store.

loans.name: Yawo

texts.fr:
Yawo est un homme âgé de quarante-huit ans. Il est marié à une revendeuse. Il a trois enfants.
Il travaille comme revendeur et vend des matériaux de construction pour toutes personnes dans sa boutique. 
Yawo a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des matériaux de constructions. Il veut utiliser ses profits supplémentaires pour assurer les biens de sa maison et de prendre bien soin de ses enfants. 
Dans les prochaines années, Yawo voudrait avoir plus de matériaux dans son magasin pour mieux satisfaire ses clients. Il dit qu’avec des profits, il prévoit d`améliorer la condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Yawo is a 48 year old man. He is married to a retailer and has three children.
He works as a salesman and sells construction materials to anyone who comes to his shop.
Yawo requests his second loan from Wages in order to buy construction materials. He wants to use the extra profits to take care of the things in his home and to look after his children.
In the coming years Yawo would like to have more stock in his shop to better satisfy his customers. He says that with the profits, he plans to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Nizar

texts.en:
Nizar is a 23-year-old single man, who has worked providing internet services to offices and houses inside his village for the past four years. He is a hard worker who puts a lot of effort into expanding his working area and providing the best customer service ever to avoid competition. Nizar also works at installing surveillance cameras upon request.

Nizar is applying for a Youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy necessary items to expand his network, and so increase his customers.

Nizar is planning to keep on expanding his work area by covering nearby villages with his present service.

loans.use: To buy necessary items to expand his network.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single mother of seven children, two of whom go to school. She has a business selling vegetables, and has been in this business for 30 years. She has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy more bundles of vegetables. 

Margaret works at the market seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and seasonality. She aspires of growing vegetables like cabbages and onions. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and paying for water bills.

loans.use: to buy more bundles of vegetables to sell, such as cabbages and onions.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is married with four children, three of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for four years. She works from home seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis only. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She generates additional income through selling and frying cassava. 

Christine has applied for a loan of 200,000 UGX from MCDTSACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. 

She is aspiring of becoming a wholesaler and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Erdenebayar

texts.en:
Mr. Erdenebayar is 51 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a Ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. His wife Gerelmaa works as saleswoman in a local market. His two sons, Bazarsad and Badraa, are university students. He has been paying his sons' university tuition fees and need to work twice as hard to cover family expense. 

He has a general store retail in Soums, a smaller administrative area within the province, and imports inventory from China. He is now requesting a loan of 3,500,000MNT to purchase a large amount of inventory from China to sell to Soum customers. This way, he will increase sales and be able to pay his sons' tuition fees this academic year. He is a hardworking, optimistic and responsible man.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of inventory from China to sell to customers and increase sales so he can pay his sons' tuition fees for this academic year.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is 37 years old, and is married with has two sons. She and her husband earn a living selling electronic appliances. They started this business ten years ago. 

Hanh is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of electronic appliances to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety of electronic appliances to sell in her store.

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong, 47, is married. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn a living making and selling leather shoes. They started this business 13 years ago. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying better quality of leather materials to make better shoes and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy leather to make shoes.

loans.name: Yulce

texts.en:
Yulce, is a 22-year-old single woman and she is living with her parents. Since graduating from elementary school, Yulce has not continued her formal education. She decided to assist her parents working as a farmer instead. She manages her own land by planting paddy, corn and vegetables. The harvest is then sold to the traders at the traditional markets every week.

Yulce has another vacant piece of land that is not managed yet. Since her plan is to manage her vacant land, she needs capital to purchase seedlings and fertilizer to make it happen. In addition, Yulce also wants to develop a business selling gasoline. 

Therefore, Yulce has applied for a loan to TLM for an amount of IDR 10,000,000 to support her businesses to grow.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizer and also to initiate a business selling gasoline.

loans.name: Yolanda De Jesús

texts.es: Yolanda, a sus 55 años es casada y no tiene hijos. Se dedica a la confección de manera independiente desde el año 2008 y su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la casa donde reside. De esta manera ha logrado obtener los recursos para solventar las necesidades de su familia y para afrontar los gastos mensuales que no dan espera. La cliente es una mujer pujante, dedicada a su labor y a su familia, trabaja arduas jornadas diariamente para poder salir adelante. Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de activo fijo (máquina ecubridora) de esta forma podrá sacar la producción a tiempo y venderla a mejor precio, pues las prendas estarán bien terminadas y tendrán buena calidad para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, lo que se verá reflejado en el incremento de sus ventas e ingresos. Yolanda sueña con tener su negocio bien acreditado, con máquinas especializadas que le permitan disminuir el tiempo de producción para sacar más lotes de prendas y tener mejores ingresos por ventas, que le ayude a mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y seguir aportando a los gastos y sustento diario de su hogar.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 55 years old, married, and has no children.  She has worked as an independent seamstress since 2008 and her business is located in the house where she lives.  In this way she has managed to obtain the resources to maintain her family and to face the monthly expenses that are unexpected.  She is a thriving woman, dedicated to her work and her family, who works arduous hours daily in order to get ahead.

Currently she is asking for a loan in order to invest in the purchase of a specialized sewing machine (an overstiching machine) and in this way she will be able to complete her products on time and sell them at a better price, since her pieces will be finished well and will have great quality to satisfy the needs of her customers.  That will then be reflected in her sales and income.  Yolanda dreams of having a well capitalized business, with specialized machines that permit her to decrease the time of production in order to take more orders and have better income through sales.  This will help her improve the quality of life for her family and will continue to support the expenses of her household.

loans.use: to purchase a specialized sewing machine (an over-stiching or finishing machine)

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh is 56 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have earned income by running a general store in her community for 14 years.

She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a great quantity and variety of food products and household items to stock her store. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a great quantity and variety of food products and household items to stock her store.

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Pol is 58 years old and a single mother of two children. She is a hard-working woman who is dedicated to the farming business, growing rice in Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She has been in this for over 20 years and it is the sole source of her family’s income.

At the moment, she has requested a loan amounting to KHR 2,000,000 to buy an extra plot to expand her rice production. Through the loan support and her perseverance, she hopes her business will be successful and have a good harvest someday.

loans.use: to buy an extra plot to expand her rice production.

loans.name: Drita

texts.en:
Drita is a 45-year-old villager who has been operating a greenhouse, the one in the picture, for the past ten years. She is married and has two school-age children and also a disabled husband that she has to take care of. Their family lives in the central-rural Albania and since this village is not very far from a main city, villagers wake up very early in the mornings to take their produce for sale to the local market of the city. The streets however, these past years, are in a much better condition so, that makes it easy for them to carry their items, some with donkeys and some others with horses; yet, usually in these villages, donkeys are the preferred transportation animal.

Drita wants to repair her greenhouse and add some more space to it; this is the reason why she is requesting this loan.

loans.use: to repair her greenhouse and make it more spacious.

loans.name: Beka

texts.en:
Beka is 23 years old, single and lives in a small village of Aghaiani, with his parents. Beka is an assistant of the operator at the local asphalt factory and gets a monthly income. His parents run an agricultural business and grow peaches in their garden. They also graft the plants and sell them in the capital city open market and also sell picked peaches. 

Beka requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for an agricultural business start-up, but had no success. His loan request was rejected because of his low income and lack of experience in the new business. Recently, Beka requested credit from Credo. He was planning to start-up the animal husbandry business. His loan request was approved, through a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides credit with soft conditions to the country's vulnerable poor, who do not have access to mainstream credit because they are regarded as “high risk borrowers,” due to low income. 

With the received credit, Beka will purchase several calves. He will keep the cattle in the shed located in his yard, raise and sell them over five to six months. After selling the calves, he will purchase more of them and go through the same cycle. The new business initiative will increase the income of the family, and Beka will be able to generate profit.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Aminata from Lunsar Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with five children. Three of her children are currently attending school.  

Aminata runs a food stand within her community she sells rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business from every day, 11 hours per day. She says that the main challenge to her business is sometime her food spoils.  

Aminata has requested a loan in order to buy rice, palm oil and cooking seasoning. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family. In the future, she plans to build a house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Hasbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Hasbaatar is 46 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a Ger, a traditional nomadic tent, in Uvs province of Mongolia. His wife, Otgonjargal, works in a local school dormitory. Both his sons, Enhbat and Enhtuvshin, are university students and the family's expenses have increased noticeably. 

Hasbaatar has been working in different business fields for years and since he need to cover his sons' tuition fees, he need to start providing a taxi service business in town to increase his income. His sons also work during their summer vacation to help their parents. 

He is now requesting a loan of 1,900,000 MNT to cover his sons' university tuition and other school-related expenses. He is a hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: to cover his sons' university tuition and other school-related expenses.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She has a business selling eggs and has been in this business for four years.  

She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more trays of eggs. She generates additional income through rearing pigs. She works in a shop and sells both on retail and wholesale. She works seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. 

She is aspiring to become a poultry farmer and also to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more trays of eggs.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang, 50, is married and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a general store in front of their house. 

They started this business seven years ago. Trang is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying better quality food products and sanitary items to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy better quality food products and sanitary items to better satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Ryzhdi

texts.en:
Ryzhdi is in his sixties and sells dairy products for living. He is married and his children are grown-ups now, but the youngest child who is married lives with his parents according to old Albanian customs that nowadays are mostly kept in the rural areas, unlike in the urban areas. The people who still keep this tradition say that it is due to respect for their elderly parents and also easier for the youngsters who don’t have to built a house of their own from scratch.  

In the picture, you see Ryzhdi. He is dressed like this because he was about to take a trip to the city for some personal matters and he was stopped to be photographed for Kiva. 

Here is what he said to the loan officer laughing: “Usually you see me in another outfit with lots of dirt on it and with my hair all messy, but today I am all spruced up because I have to visit some government offices in the city."

Ryzhdi want to buy a young dairy cow with this loan.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is single with no children. She also doesn’t take care of any additional family members. She has a business selling used shoes and used curtains. 

She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more curtains and shoes. She generates additional income from a confectionery business. She works from home six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters.  

She is aspiring to become a wholesaler and also to own shop fully packed with curtains and used shoes. She resides in her own house and has access to electricity and not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include paying for electricity.

loans.use: To buy more curtains and shoes.

loans.name: Binh

texts.en: Binh is requesting a new loan to buy a greater variety of beverages for selling. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales. She hopes it will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of beverages for selling at her food stall.

loans.name: Trang

texts.en:
Trang is 35 years old and married. She has one daughter and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Trang runs a business of selling drinking water to people in her community. She intends to use her loan to purchase a larger supply of water from wholesalers to sell to people in her local community.

She hope her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for facing difficulty in the future.

loans.use: To buy drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en:
Thu is a 57-year-old widowed woman. She lives with two children in Ho Chi Minh City. Thu earns money by running a food stall in front of her house that sells snacks, noodles and beef to people in her community.

Thu would like a loan to purchase a new show-case and food ingredients to better satisfy her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new show-case and food ingredients.

loans.name: Thuan

texts.en:
Thuan is 42 years old and married. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns her income running a business of sewing and selling clothing and linen. 

She started this business eight years ago. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of clothing materials. This will allow her to increase her production and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of clothing materials.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Elizabeth from Lunsar Northern area in Sierra Leone. She is married with 6 children. Four of her children are currently attending school.  

Elizabeth runs a food stand within her community where she sells rice, palm oil and sugar. She has been running this business since 2010. She works at the business every day for 11 hours. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to operate her business

Elizabeth has requested a loan in order to buy, rice, palm oil, sugar and pepper. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and take good care of her family. In the future, she plans to renovate her house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy rice, palm oil, sugar and pepper.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. She has a pub business and has been in this business for four years. She has applied for a loan of 200, 000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more crates of beer, soda, and jerry-cans of local gin. She generates additional income from selling green bananas. She works from home seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring to own a fully-stocked pub and also to buy a plot of land and build a house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and soda for her pub business.

loans.name: Thu

texts.en: Thu, 55 years old, is married and has three children. She and her husband earn a living selling food and beverages. They started this business one year ago. Thu is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying new furniture to better serve her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new furniture to better serve her customers.

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en:
Hoang is 27 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her mother earn income by running a business of selling food in her community for five years.

She intends to take a loan to improve her business by buying a motorcycle for going to and from market. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for going to and from the market.

loans.name: Dieu

texts.en:
Dieu is a 38-year-old married woman who lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is working as a mason, while Dieu earns money by running a business processing clothes.

Dieu is requesting a loan to purchase better-quality sewing materials for her production of clothes. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes the loan will enable her to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase better-quality sewing materials for her production of clothes

loans.name: Blanca Lidia

texts.es:
Blanca, es una persona que está acompañada y disfruta de un hijo, el cual tiene 18 años de edad, no tiene familiares en el extranjero. Ella, se dedica  a la venta de verduras, dicha actividad la realiza todos los días y lo desempeña de 4:00am a 11:00am.
El crédito que requiere le permitirá comprar diversidad de mercadería de verduras, tales como: pipián, pepinos, tomates, chiles, plátanos, yuca, entre otros. Esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar su calidad de vida.
Su deseo es comprar una casa para tener una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Blanca is a person who has a partner and is blessed with one child, who is 18 years old. She does not have family members abroad. She works selling vegetables, an activity which she carries out every day, working from 4:00 a.m. to 11:00 a.m.

The loan she needs will permit her to buy a variety of produce to sell, such as squash, cucumbers, tomatoes, chiles, plantains, and yuca, among others. This investment will help her to improve her quality of life.

Her desire is to buy a house in order to have a better life.

loans.use: to buy squash, cucumbers, tomatoes, chiles, plantains, and yuca, among others.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en:
Lan is 40 years old and married. She has two sons and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker. 

Lan has been running a general store in her home for three years. She sells a variety of products to people in their community. She intends to use her loan to buy a great quantity and variety of instant foods, beverages and sauces.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy a great quantity and variety of instant foods, beverages and sauces.

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: La Sra. Ángela tiene 33 años tiene un  hijo de la edad de 13 años, se dedica a la  venta de refrescos y variedad de dulces, galletas en su puesto de venta que se encuentra   cerca a una escuela de la zona por donde vive,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Ángela utilizara este préstamo para la compra de mercadería como  refrescos, dulces  y galletas por cantidad y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital de trabajo, la Sra. Ángela va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando cantidad de mercadería para seguir surtiendo su negocio,  su deseo de la Sra. Ángela es crecer en su negocio tener un puesto surtido,  Sra. Ángela es una persona trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Ángela is 33 years old and has one child, age 13. She works selling soft drinks and a variety of sweets and cookies from her sales stand which is located near a school in the area where she lives. This is her first loan cycle with the institution. Ángela will use this loan to buy merchandise such as soft drinks, sweets and cookies in large quantities. In this way she will increase her working capital. Her reason for requesting this loan is her lack of working capital.  Ángela will use the profits to continue buying merchandise in bulk in order to continue stocking her busiess. Ángela's desire is to expand her business and have a well-stocked sales stand. Ángela is a hard-working person. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided to her by granting the loan.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as soft drinks and sweets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his wife's tuition and other costs, and to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Quynh

texts.en:
Quynh, 31, is married. She has two children and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Quynh started selling beverages three years ago. She is requesting a loan to buy more beverages and snack foods to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more beverages and snack foods to sell.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 65 years old. He is a father of five children. He has been farming rice for the past eight years. His wife works with him. He has requested a Kiva loan to buy more fertilizer. He plans to use the profits for reinvesting in rice growing.

The agriculture sector employs 90% of Rwandans. Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. Thus, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for use in rice production.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with three children, who all go to school. She also takes care of her younger brother. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity and not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

She sells used clothes and has been in this business for 11/2 years. She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more dresses. 

She works from home seven days a week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and defaulters. She hopes to own a fully stocked boutique and also to buy a plot of land and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more dresses for resale.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Mariatu from Kambia, in the Northern Province of Sierra Leone. She is married with three children. One of her daughters is going to school. Two relatives also live in the home. 

Mariatu runs a general store in her house. She sells palm oil, rice, groundnuts (peanuts) and cooking oil. She has been running this business since 2000. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. At present, she says, her business is doing well.

Mariatu has requested a loan to buy more food commodities, like palm oil, rice, milk, sugar and cooking oil. The extra income from this loan will enable her to increase her business and improve her family's living conditions. In the future, she plans to expand the business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more food commodities, like palm oil, rice, milk, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a single mother of one child who attends school. She also takes care of additional family members. She resides in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent. 


For the past year Sarah has operated a business selling used clothes, her sole source of income. She works in a shop seven days a week, and her major business challenges include transportation and the ever-increasing price of used clothes in Uganda.


Sarah has requested a loan of 100000 Ugandan shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more used clothes such as blouses, jean skirts, trousers and dresses. She aspires to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land upon which to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more used clothes like blouses, jean skirts, trousers and dresses.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin, 45, is married with five children. He has spent more than 15 years in rice farming. With this loan, Celestin will buy more fertilizers for use in rice production. The profits from his yield will be used to provide the family’s basic needs.

Note: the agriculture sector accounts for 37 per cent of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65 per cent of Rwanda's export revenue and, as of 2009, employs approximately 90 per cent of Rwandans. Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for use in rice production.

loans.name: Edwin David

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre de 26 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Edwin no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil que deseaba.
Por iniciativa propia, Edwin trabaja como albañil, el realiza diversas obras de construcción y trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas, Edwin cree que le va bien por su dedicación.
Edwin se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada mejorará y reforzará una habitación en su vivienda, de esta manera el y su familia tendrán mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues Edwin seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Edwin is 26 years old. He is single and lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. He is a kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a great desire to succeed. Unfortunately, due to lack of financial resources and the need to work, Edwin could not study for a career in Civil Engineering but he wanted to.

On his own initiative, Edwin works as a mason, working at diverse building sites and he works approximately 10 hours a day. Edwin believes he is doing well because of his dedication.

Edwin is very grateful to Kiva lenders as thanks to the support he can improve and strengthen a room in his home so that his family will have better security and wellbeing, and so he can continue working and struggling to achieve his big dream of having his own home.

loans.use: to pay for materials to improve his housing for better security and wellbeing

loans.name: David Antonio

texts.es:
David, vive con su esposa con la cual ya tiene un año de estar casado. El, posee una taller de mecánica automotriz en la Cuidad de Corinto, lo desempeña todos los días y dicha actividad la aprendió desde muy pequeño, asimismo ha tomado clases para desempeñarlo mejor; hoy en día quiere brindar servicio de viaje con moto taxi para mejorar sus ingresos.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar una moto taxi para obtener mayores utilidades, ya que este es un servicio muy rentable y de ayuda para las personas.
Su sueño es que esta nueva actividad que emprenderá, llene sus expectativas  y así ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
David lives with his wife and has been married for one year. He owns a automotive repair shop in the city of Corinto. He works every day and he learned this activity when he was very young. He has also taken classes so he can do it better. 

At this time he wants to offer a motorcycle taxi service in order to improve his income. He is asking for a loan in order to buy a motorcycle taxi in order to obtain higher profits as this is a profitable service and helps people. His dream is that this new activity that he is beginning meets his expectations and provides a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle taxi to provide taxi services

loans.name: Zapatito Veloz De Ventilla Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ZAPATITO VELOZ DE VENTILLA”  iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jhanet es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de chiflería, tienda de barrio, venta de comida, chofer.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jhanet es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio inicio con su madre hace varios años, con el pasar del tiempo decidió continuar con el mismo negocio, ya que es un buen negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de arroz, fideo, aceite) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.
 
Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito,  ahorro, las capacitaciones y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Zapatito Velos de Ventilla” is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center.  This group consists of eight members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Jhanet serves as the treasurer.  The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as selling low-cost goods, managing a neighborhood store, selling food, and working as a chauffeur.  

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Jhanet.  She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago after receiving an invitation from a friend who is a member of the organization.  Jhanet currently has a business where she sells food.  She started this business after having worked with her mother for several years.  Over the course of time, she decided to continue in the same line of work since it is a good business.  

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying rice, noodles, and oil.  She will acquire these supplies from the wholesale vendors in the city of La Paz and then use them for making the dishes that she sells from her vending space.  Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family.  Jhanet is in a common-law relationship and has one child.  

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Jhanet said that she enjoys the loans, the savings, the training seminars, and the health services.

loans.use: to buy rice, noodles, and oil.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: La Sra. Mariana  es cliente antigua d ela institución, sigue la misma actividad de la Venta de comida, cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas,   cada préstamo que saco con la institución es para el mejoramiento de su actividad, es una cliente responsable y trabajadora, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de mesas y sillas para su negocio ya que creció en su actividad y en clientela y desea brindar mayor comodidad a su clientela  se siente feliz y agradecida por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en: Mariana is an old client of Emprender. She continues with the same activity of selling meals. She says that she did very well with her last loan that she used to buy ingredients to make her meals. Each loan that she takes through the institution is to improve her business. She is responsible and hardworking. At this time she is asking for a loan in order to buy tables and chairs for her business as her business has grown and she wants to make her customers more comfortable. She feels happy and grateful for the opportunity given her to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs for her business

loans.name: Pastoritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PASTORITAS”  iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Modesta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: elaboración de alfombras, venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de lana, elaboración de sogas, venta de carne, venta de api, venta de cosméticos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Modesta es integrante, ella indica que hace siete meses que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración y venta de busos y medias; este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, al observar la demanda de este producto.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de lana) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el trabajo en grupo y el asesoramiento.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Pastoritas” (The Little Shepherds) is starting its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Los Andes Community Center. This group consists of nine members and is led by a Board of Directors in which Sra. Modesta is the president. The members of this Communal Bank engage in various businesses such as making rugs, selling food, selling clothes, selling wool, making rope, selling meat, selling “apí” (a beverage made from corn), and selling cosmetics.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Sra. Modesta. She says that she joined Pro Mujer seven months ago after receiving an invitation from a promoter from the organization who visited her at her house. Modesta currently has a business of making and selling sweatshirts and stockings. She started this business on her own after noticing that there was a demand for these products.

The loan she is receiving now will be used to increase her capital for buying wool, which she will acquire from the wholesale vendors in the city of El Alto. She will then use this material for making the products she sells from her retail space. Working in this manner enables her to generate income for supporting her family. Modesta is married and has two children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Modesta said that she enjoys working in a group and with the advisors.

loans.use: to buy wool for making stockings and sweatshirts.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is married and has one school-going child. She also takes care of her mother. Aisha resides in the family's house, which has electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and utility bills.

Aisha has been operating a restaurant for two years. She works six days a week and sells food to all people on a retail basis. She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more green bananas, beef, and rice. Her major business challenges include transportation and defaulters.

loans.use: to buy more green bananas, beef, and rice.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Isatu is 38 years old and married with 3 children between the ages of 9 years and 20 years. She runs a clothing business in Rokupr, the northern area in Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for 10 years and sells wax cotton and jeans.  She says that the main challenge to her business is slow purchasing power during the rainy season.

Isatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy more wax cotton and jeans for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her support her children and take care of her family. In the future, she would like to open a big shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy more wax cotton and jeans for resale.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is 27 years old and married with 1 child aged 5 years. She runs a clothing business in Rokupr in the northern area of Sierra Leone.

She's been in this business for 7 years and sells different types of baby clothes and blouses.  She says that her business is doing well because she is able to take care of her family out of the profit.

Kadiatu requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to buy different types of baby clothes and blouses for resale. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, she would like to open a big clothing shop. She is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to buy different types of baby clothes and blouses for resale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is married with six children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and brother).

She has a stone quarry business and has been in this business for 20 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to hire men to help in quarrying.  She works in a shop seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She aspires to invest in used clothes.

She resides in the family house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to hire men to help in stone quarrying

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 53-year-old Fatmata from Rokupr. She is widowed with 2 children. She began this business to create a permanent source of income. 

Fatmata runs a food stand. She sells palm oil, beans and pepper.  She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business throughout the week, 12 hours per day. At present she says her business is doing well.

Fatmata has requested a loan in order to buy more food commodities like palm oil, rice, and gari (cassava flakes). The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her family's status. In the future, she plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more food commodities like palm oil, rice, and gari

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en: Kasifa is married with three children and all of her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (mother). She has a business of selling green bananas and has been in this business for two years. She has applied for a loan of 100,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She also generates additional income through selling tomatoes and banana leaves. She works seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She aspires to own a delivery van to ease the transportation and also to build a house. She resides in rented house, and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more  bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Luz Estela

texts.es: Estela es madre soltera de un hijo de 24 años de edad. Toda su vida productiva la ha dedicado a laborar como auxiliar de enfermería en diferentes clínicas y hospitales, pero debido a la difícil situación económica por la que atravesaba, decidió alternar su empleo con la venta de mercancía, con el fin de generar ingresos extra para solventar todos los gastos y necesidades básicas de su hogar, pues toda la carga económica recae directamente sobre ella, porque nunca recibió la colaboración, ni el apoyo del padre de su hijo.  Ella ofrece calzado, bolsos y ropa para dama, no tiene un horario de trabajo establecido, ya que depende de los turnos que tenga en su empleo. Estela es una mujer luchadora, dedicada y muy activa, diariamente se esmera por cumplir sus objetivos y sueña con tener un almacén bien acreditado y rentable, y cuando llegue la hora de pensionarse, poder seguir generando ingresos y lograr una estabilidad económica favorable. Esto la motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito, para invertirlo en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (blusas, jeans, calzado, bolsos) y adecuar el espacio para un vestier; con esto logrará tener más variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes, satisfaciendo los diversos gustos y necesidades, además podrá brindar un mejor servicio que le permita fidelizar su clientela y aumentar sus ventas e ingresos, para dar a su hijo la oportunidad de tener educación universitaria y disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Estela is a single mother of a 24-year-old son.  Her entire productive life has been spent working as a nursing assistant at different clinics and hospitals.  Due to a difficult financial situation, she decided to divide her time between her job and selling merchandise in hopes of generating extra income to pay for all of her expenses and basic household needs.  All of the financial responsibilities fall on her because she never received assistance or support from the father of her child. 
 
Estela offers shoes, bags, and clothing for women.  She does not have an established work schedule, since a lot of it depends on the shifts she has work at her job.  Estela is a determined, dedicated, and active woman who strives each day to accomplish her goals.  Her dream is to have a reputable and profitable store.  When she retires, she hopes that such a business will continue generating income so that she can have a decent level of financial stability.  

The reason for requesting this loan is so that she can invest in the purchase of merchandise in bulk (blouses, jeans, shoes, and bags) and to create a space for a changing room.  With this loan, she hopes to offer a wider variety of products to her customers and satisfy their tastes and needs.  In addition, she hopes to provide better service so that her customers remain loyal and her sales and income increase.  As a result, she will be able to provide her son the chance to have a university education and to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise in bulk (blouses, jeans, shoes, and bags) and to create a space for a changing room.

loans.name: Siba Group

texts.en:
Fitnah is the featured borrower of Siba group.  She went along with her other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Fitnah is a 40-year-old married mother of three children. She has been working in selling home products since two years ago to help her husband in making their living and covering their family's increasing expenses.

Fitnah is acquiring a loan in order to increase her merchandise with a new collection of specially released home products so she can please her customers' needs and satisfy their desires.  At the same time she will be increasing her family's income and developing her business.

She is the one sitting at the right side with a white veil. As for the other group members, Sarah is seated in the middle and Rabiha is the one at the left.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of specially released home products

loans.name: Jamesetta

texts.en:
Jamesetta is 33 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has a nine-year-old child who is attending school and lives at home.
